name: Neural-Fuzzer
tagline: Learn from your test cases & discover bugs in your software
body:
Neural-Fuzzer is an experimental fuzzer designed to use state-of-the-art Machine Learning to learn from a set of initial files. It works in two phases: **training** and **generation**.

* In training mode:  it uses [long-short term memory (LSTM)](https://colah.github.io/posts/2015-08-Understanding-LSTMs/) to learn how sequences of bytes are structured. 

* In generation mode: it will automatically generate corrupted or unexpected files and it will try to crash a given program. 

Neural-Fuzzer is powered by [keras](http://keras.io) and it is similar to [rnn-char](https://github.com/karpathy/char-rnn) and other techniques in sequence prediction.

## Features

* Basic triage of crashes found using GDB.
* CPU and GPU supported! (you can train in GPU but later use your CPU to generate files and test your program).
* Test your program while in the training phase.

## Getting started with Neural-Fuzzer

1. Install the [last version of keras](http://keras.io/#installation).
1. Clone our repository:
    $ git clone https://github.com/CIFASIS/neural-fuzzer/
1. ... 

## Pre-trained generators

* Jpeg
* Png
* Xml
* Pdf?

## Authors

* Gustavo **Grieco** (dev)
* Guillermo Luis **Grinblat**
* Lucas **Uzal**
